title: Glyphs-inside-squares fonts
content:
Sorry but I don't know the exact term, but you know what I mean, can anyone please list some examples of fonts with glyphs inscribed inside black squares?

Thanks a lot
author: carlos_moreno_

comments.content: Well, the letters aren't inscribed in squares, but I quite like [Frutiger Stones](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105064158/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/frutiger-stones).

thank you all, but I was looking for something more old fashioned, like this

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131105064158im_/http:/typophile.com/files/poesia#15_4639.jpg)
I think that the one in your sample is just a graphic contruction using a "normal" typeface.
for sure, and I'm afraid nothing similar exists as typeface...
(At least in the case of Gill Sans,) the boxed version of a font is called "Cameo."
